title: H004: Add project documentation
description: Write operator documentation: installation guide, CRD reference with all fields documented, upgrade guide, troubleshooting, architecture overview. Include example CRs for common use cases (minimal, HA, monitoring-enabled, TLS-enabled).

stories.title: Operator user can install the operator following an installation guide
stories.want: a step-by-step installation guide covering prerequisites, CRD installation, operator deployment, and verification
stories.so_that: I can deploy the memcached-operator to my Kubernetes cluster without guessing at commands or configuration
criteria: Guide lists all prerequisites: Go 1.25+, Docker, kubectl, Kubernetes cluster, Operator SDK v1.42+, cert-manager (for webhooks)
Guide includes commands for CRD-only installation (`make install`) and full deployment (`make deploy IMG=...`)
Guide includes verification steps: `kubectl get crd memcacheds.memcached.c5c3.io`, `kubectl get pods -n memcached-operator-system`
Guide covers local development mode (`make run`) and cluster deployment mode
Guide documents image build and push steps (`make docker-build`, `make docker-push`)

stories.title: Operator user can look up any CRD field in a comprehensive reference
stories.want: a complete CRD field reference documenting every spec and status field with types, defaults, validation, and descriptions
stories.so_that: I can configure Memcached CRs correctly without reading Go source code
criteria: Every MemcachedSpec field is documented with type, default, validation constraints, and description
Every nested struct (MemcachedConfig, HighAvailabilitySpec, MonitoringSpec, SecuritySpec, etc.) has its own section
Status fields and conditions (Available, Progressing, Degraded) are documented
Webhook validation rules and defaulting behavior are described
Parameter-to-memcached-flag mapping table is included (maxMemoryMB → -m, etc.)

stories.title: Operator user can upgrade the operator using an upgrade guide
stories.want: an upgrade guide covering version-to-version migration, CRD updates, and rolling upgrade procedure
stories.so_that: I can upgrade the operator safely without downtime or data loss in managed Memcached instances
criteria: Guide documents the upgrade sequence: CRDs first, then operator Deployment
Guide explains backward compatibility guarantees of v1alpha1 API
Guide includes pre-upgrade checklist: backup CRs, check operator logs, verify cluster health
Guide documents rollback procedure if upgrade fails
Guide covers `make deploy IMG=<new-version>` workflow

stories.title: Operator user can diagnose common issues using a troubleshooting guide
stories.want: a troubleshooting guide with symptom-based sections covering common failure modes
stories.so_that: I can quickly resolve operational issues without escalating to the operator developers
criteria: Guide covers: CR stuck in Progressing, pods CrashLooping, ServiceMonitor not created, webhook admission errors, operator not reconciling, metrics not available
Each section follows Symptom → Diagnosis (commands) → Common Causes → Fix pattern
All diagnostic commands use kubectl and are copy-pasteable
Guide references operator log locations and how to increase log verbosity
Guide covers RBAC troubleshooting with `kubectl auth can-i`

stories.title: Operator user can understand the architecture from a visual overview
stories.want: an architecture overview document explaining the operator's design, reconciliation flow, managed resources, and design principles
stories.so_that: I can understand how the operator works and predict its behavior
criteria: Document includes ASCII or Mermaid diagram of the operator architecture showing Manager, Reconciler, Webhook Server, Metrics Server, and managed resources
Document explains the reconciliation flow from CR creation to resource creation
Document lists all managed resources (Deployment, Service, PDB, ServiceMonitor, NetworkPolicy) and their purpose
Document explains design principles: declarative, idempotent, level-triggered, Kubernetes-native
Document describes watch setup and owner reference garbage collection

stories.title: Operator user can deploy common configurations using example CRs
stories.want: a set of annotated example CRs for common use cases: minimal, HA, monitoring-enabled, TLS-enabled, production
stories.so_that: I can quickly deploy Memcached clusters tailored to my environment without writing CRs from scratch
criteria: Minimal example: single replica with defaults, includes inline comments
HA example: 3 replicas, anti-affinity, topology spread, PDB, resource limits
Monitoring example: exporter sidecar, ServiceMonitor with custom labels
TLS example: TLS enabled with certificateSecretRef, optional mTLS
Production example: combines HA + monitoring + security contexts + node selectors + tolerations

stories.title: Developer can navigate documentation from a central index
stories.want: a documentation index page that links to all documentation sections (installation, CRD reference, architecture, upgrade, troubleshooting, examples)
stories.so_that: I can find any documentation quickly without searching through the file tree
criteria: Index page exists at docs/index.md or equivalent location
All documentation sections are linked with brief descriptions
Documentation is organized by Diataxis quadrant: reference, how-to, explanation
Index includes links to existing reference docs in docs/reference/backend/

requirements.description: The documentation SHALL include a step-by-step installation guide covering prerequisites, CRD installation, local development mode, cluster deployment, and verification
requirements.rationale: Users need clear instructions to deploy the operator; without an installation guide, adoption is blocked

scenarios.name: Guide covers prerequisites
scenarios.when: a user reads the installation guide
scenarios.then: all required tools and versions are listed: Go 1.25+, Docker, kubectl, Kubernetes cluster, cert-manager
and_then: links to installation instructions for each prerequisite are provided

scenarios.name: Guide covers local development
scenarios.when: a user follows the local development section
scenarios.then: the guide includes `make install` and `make run` commands with expected output
and_then: a sample CR apply and verification step is included

scenarios.name: Guide covers cluster deployment
scenarios.when: a user follows the cluster deployment section
scenarios.then: the guide includes `make docker-build`, `make docker-push`, `make deploy` commands with IMG parameter
and_then: verification commands check CRD, operator pod, and sample CR creation

requirements.description: The documentation SHALL include a comprehensive CRD reference documenting every spec field, status field, nested struct, defaults, validation constraints, and webhook behavior
requirements.rationale: The CRD reference is the primary API documentation; incomplete field documentation leads to misconfiguration

scenarios.name: All spec fields documented
scenarios.when: a user looks up any MemcachedSpec field
scenarios.then: the field is documented with Go type, JSON key, default value, validation constraints, and description
and_then: nested structs have their own sections with the same level of detail

scenarios.name: Status fields documented
scenarios.when: a user looks up status fields
scenarios.then: conditions (Available, Progressing, Degraded) are documented with their meanings and transitions

scenarios.name: Webhook behavior documented
scenarios.when: a user reads the webhook section
scenarios.then: defaulting rules and validation rules are listed with specific constraints
and_then: examples of rejected configurations are provided

requirements.description: The documentation SHALL include an upgrade guide with pre-upgrade checklist, upgrade procedure, post-upgrade verification, and rollback instructions
requirements.rationale: Operators in production need safe upgrade paths; missing upgrade docs risk downtime

scenarios.name: Pre-upgrade checklist
scenarios.when: a user plans an upgrade
scenarios.then: the guide provides a checklist: export current CRs, check operator health, review release notes

scenarios.name: Upgrade procedure
scenarios.when: a user performs the upgrade
scenarios.then: the guide documents: update CRDs first (`make install`), then deploy new operator version (`make deploy IMG=...`)
and_then: verification commands confirm the new version is running and reconciling

scenarios.name: Rollback procedure
scenarios.when: an upgrade fails
scenarios.then: the guide documents how to revert: redeploy previous operator image and verify CR status

requirements.description: The documentation SHALL include a troubleshooting guide covering at least 6 common failure scenarios with symptom, diagnosis, causes, and fix for each
requirements.rationale: Operational issues are inevitable; a troubleshooting guide reduces MTTR and support burden

scenarios.name: Each scenario has diagnostic commands
scenarios.when: a user encounters a listed symptom
scenarios.then: copy-pasteable kubectl commands are provided for diagnosis

scenarios.name: Common causes are listed
scenarios.when: a user runs the diagnostic commands
scenarios.then: the guide lists 2-4 common causes per scenario with specific fixes

scenarios.name: All major failure modes covered
scenarios.when: a user reviews the troubleshooting guide
scenarios.then: at least these scenarios are covered: stuck Progressing, CrashLoopBackOff, ServiceMonitor missing, webhook errors, operator not reconciling, metrics unavailable

requirements.description: The documentation SHALL include an architecture overview with visual diagrams, reconciliation flow, managed resources, design principles, and watch/ownership model
requirements.rationale: Understanding the operator architecture is essential for debugging, contributing, and trusting the operator in production

scenarios.name: Architecture diagram present
scenarios.when: a user reads the architecture overview
scenarios.then: a visual diagram shows the Operator Manager, MemcachedReconciler, Webhook Server, Metrics Server, and all managed resources

scenarios.name: Reconciliation flow documented
scenarios.when: a user reads the reconciliation section
scenarios.then: the step-by-step flow is documented: fetch CR → reconcile Deployment → reconcile Service → reconcile PDB → reconcile ServiceMonitor → reconcile NetworkPolicy → update Status
and_then: requeue strategy is explained: 10s when not ready, 60s when fully reconciled

scenarios.name: Design principles explained
scenarios.when: a user reads the design principles section
scenarios.then: declarative, idempotent, level-triggered, and Kubernetes-native principles are explained with examples

requirements.description: The documentation SHALL include annotated example CRs for at least 4 use cases: minimal, high-availability, monitoring-enabled, and TLS-enabled
requirements.rationale: Example CRs are the fastest onboarding path; annotated examples teach users the API by example

scenarios.name: Minimal example
scenarios.when: a user reads the minimal example
scenarios.then: a CR with only `replicas: 1` is shown with comments explaining which defaults apply

scenarios.name: HA example
scenarios.when: a user reads the HA example
scenarios.then: a CR with 3 replicas, antiAffinityPreset, topologySpreadConstraints, PDB, and resources is shown with annotations

scenarios.name: Monitoring example
scenarios.when: a user reads the monitoring example
scenarios.then: a CR with monitoring.enabled, exporterImage, exporterResources, and serviceMonitor config is shown

scenarios.name: TLS example
scenarios.when: a user reads the TLS example
scenarios.then: a CR with security.tls.enabled, certificateSecretRef, and optional enableClientCert is shown
and_then: prerequisite Secret creation commands are included

requirements.description: The documentation SHALL provide a documentation index page linking to all sections organized by Diataxis quadrant
requirements.rationale: Without a navigation index, users cannot discover available documentation

scenarios.name: Index links all sections
scenarios.when: a user opens the documentation index
scenarios.then: links to installation guide, CRD reference, architecture, upgrade guide, troubleshooting, and examples are present

scenarios.name: Index organized by quadrant
scenarios.when: a user reviews the index structure
scenarios.then: sections are grouped under Reference, How-to, and Explanation headings

scenarios.name: Existing reference docs linked
scenarios.when: a user looks for backend reference docs
scenarios.then: the index includes links to all existing docs in docs/reference/backend/

requirements.description: All documentation SHOULD use consistent formatting: Markdown with tables for field references, code blocks for YAML/commands, and follow existing docs/reference/backend/ conventions
requirements.rationale: Consistent formatting improves readability and maintains professional documentation quality

scenarios.name: Field tables use consistent format
scenarios.when: documentation includes field reference tables
scenarios.then: tables use columns: Field, Type, Required, Default, Validation, Description — matching existing CRD docs pattern

scenarios.name: Commands in code blocks
scenarios.when: documentation includes shell commands
scenarios.then: commands are in ```bash code blocks and are copy-pasteable

scenarios.name: YAML examples annotated
scenarios.when: documentation includes YAML examples
scenarios.then: examples are in ```yaml code blocks with inline comments explaining key fields

requirements.description: Example CR YAML files SHALL be valid against the current CRD schema and deployable on a cluster with the operator installed
requirements.rationale: Invalid examples erode trust and waste user time debugging documentation errors

scenarios.name: Examples use correct apiVersion and kind
scenarios.when: any example CR is applied to a cluster
scenarios.then: the apiVersion is memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1 and kind is Memcached

scenarios.name: Examples pass webhook validation
scenarios.when: any example CR is submitted with webhooks enabled
scenarios.then: the CR passes both defaulting and validation webhooks without errors

scenarios.name: Field names match CRD types.go
scenarios.when: any example CR is reviewed
scenarios.then: all field names in YAML match the json tags in api/v1alpha1/memcached_types.go exactly

tasks.title: Create documentation index page at docs/index.md linking all sections and existing reference docs (REQ-007)
Write architecture overview at docs/explanation/architecture-overview.md with diagrams, reconciliation flow, managed resources, design principles, and watch model (REQ-005)
Write comprehensive CRD field reference at docs/reference/crd-reference.md documenting all spec/status fields, nested structs, defaults, validation, and webhook behavior (REQ-002, REQ-008)
Write installation guide at docs/how-to/installation.md covering prerequisites, CRD install, local dev, cluster deployment, and verification (REQ-001, REQ-008)
Write upgrade guide at docs/how-to/upgrade.md covering pre-upgrade checklist, CRD update, operator deployment, verification, and rollback (REQ-003, REQ-008)
Write troubleshooting guide at docs/how-to/troubleshooting.md covering 6+ failure scenarios with symptom/diagnosis/causes/fix pattern (REQ-004, REQ-008)
Write example CRs document at docs/how-to/examples.md with annotated minimal, HA, monitoring, TLS, and production examples (REQ-006, REQ-009)
Create example CR YAML files in config/samples/: minimal.yaml, ha.yaml, monitoring.yaml, tls.yaml, production.yaml matching the examples doc (REQ-006, REQ-009)
Update config/samples/kustomization.yaml to include all new example CR files (REQ-006)
Update docs/index.md to cross-reference all new docs and verify all links resolve correctly (REQ-007)
Write test that validates all example CR YAML files in config/samples/ parse as valid Memcached objects and pass webhook validation (REQ-009)
Write test that validates all YAML code blocks in docs/how-to/examples.md parse as valid Memcached CRs with correct apiVersion/kind/field names (REQ-009)
Write test that validates all internal links in documentation files resolve to existing files or anchors (REQ-007)

test_specifications.story: Operator user can deploy common configurations using example CRs
test_specifications.expected: All YAML files in config/samples/ should deserialize into valid Memcached objects with correct apiVersion and kind

test_specifications.story: Operator user can deploy common configurations using example CRs
test_specifications.expected: All sample CRs should pass the validation webhook logic (ValidateCreate) without errors

test_specifications.expected: All YAML code blocks in docs/how-to/examples.md that have apiVersion memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1 should deserialize into valid Memcached objects

test_specifications.story: Operator user can deploy common configurations using example CRs
test_specifications.expected: All doc example CRs should pass validation webhook logic without errors

test_specifications.story: Developer can navigate documentation from a central index
test_specifications.expected: All relative Markdown links in docs/ files should resolve to existing files

test_specifications.story: Developer can navigate documentation from a central index
test_specifications.expected: docs/index.md should contain links to all documentation files in docs/ subdirectories

test_specifications.story: Operator user can deploy common configurations using example CRs
test_specifications.expected: All field names in sample CR YAML files should match json tags in memcached_types.go — no unknown fields

test_specifications.story: Operator user can deploy common configurations using example CRs
test_specifications.expected: The minimal sample CR should specify only metadata.name and spec.replicas, relying on defaults for everything else

review_criteria: All 7 documentation files exist at their specified paths: docs/index.md, docs/explanation/architecture-overview.md, docs/reference/crd-reference.md, docs/how-to/installation.md, docs/how-to/upgrade.md, docs/how-to/troubleshooting.md, docs/how-to/examples.md

CRD reference covers every field in api/v1alpha1/memcached_types.go including all nested structs (MemcachedConfig, HighAvailabilitySpec, GracefulShutdownSpec, PDBSpec, MonitoringSpec, ServiceMonitorSpec, SecuritySpec, SASLSpec, TLSSpec, NetworkPolicySpec, ServiceSpec)
All 5 example CR YAML files exist in config/samples/ (minimal, ha, monitoring, tls, production) and parse without errors
All example CRs use correct apiVersion memcached.c5c3.io/v1alpha1 and pass validation webhook logic
Installation guide includes both local dev (make install + make run) and cluster deployment (docker-build + deploy) workflows with verification steps
Troubleshooting guide covers at least 6 scenarios: stuck Progressing, CrashLoopBackOff, ServiceMonitor missing, webhook errors, operator not reconciling, metrics unavailable
Architecture overview includes a visual diagram (ASCII art or Mermaid) showing operator components and managed resources
All tests pass: sample CR validation, doc example validation, and documentation link resolution tests
Documentation uses consistent formatting matching existing docs/reference/backend/ patterns (Markdown tables, code blocks, Source header)
docs/index.md links to all documentation sections and all existing docs in docs/reference/backend/
implementation_notes:
This feature is documentation-only — no Go source code changes to the operator itself. However, it includes Go test files that validate documentation accuracy against the actual CRD types.

**File organization:**
- `docs/index.md` — Central navigation page organized by Diataxis quadrants
- `docs/explanation/architecture-overview.md` — Architecture explanation
- `docs/reference/crd-reference.md` — Comprehensive CRD field reference (separate from the existing per-component reference docs in docs/reference/backend/)
- `docs/how-to/installation.md` — Installation how-to guide
- `docs/how-to/upgrade.md` — Upgrade how-to guide
- `docs/how-to/troubleshooting.md` — Troubleshooting how-to guide
- `docs/how-to/examples.md` — Annotated example CRs how-to guide
- `config/samples/memcached_v1alpha1_minimal.yaml` — Minimal example CR
- `config/samples/memcached_v1alpha1_ha.yaml` — HA example CR
- `config/samples/memcached_v1alpha1_monitoring.yaml` — Monitoring example CR
- `config/samples/memcached_v1alpha1_tls.yaml` — TLS example CR
- `config/samples/memcached_v1alpha1_production.yaml` — Production example CR

**Existing docs to reference but NOT duplicate:**
The `docs/reference/backend/` directory already contains 28 detailed reference docs for individual components (deployment-reconciliation.md, memcached-crd-types.md, tls-encryption.md, etc.). The new `docs/reference/crd-reference.md` provides a unified user-facing CRD field reference, while the existing docs serve as developer-facing implementation references. The index page should link to both.

**Key patterns to follow:**
- Match the format of `docs/reference/backend/memcached-crd-types.md` for field reference tables (columns: Field, Type, Required, Default, Validation, Description)
- Use `**Source**: file paths` header convention from existing docs
- YAML examples should match the CRD types exactly — use the actual Go types in api/v1alpha1/memcached_types.go as the source of truth
- Example CRs should be consistent with config/samples/memcached_v1alpha1_memcached.yaml patterns

**Test strategy:**
- Tests validate that documentation stays in sync with code — if CRD types change, tests will fail until docs are updated
- Sample CR validation uses the actual Kubernetes scheme and webhook validation functions
- Doc example extraction parses YAML blocks from Markdown files
- Link validation checks relative paths resolve to real files

**Risks:**
- CRD reference could become stale if types.go changes without updating docs — mitigated by validation tests
- YAML examples could use incorrect field names — mitigated by deserialization tests with strict unknown field rejection
- Links could break as docs structure evolves — mitigated by link validation test
